fr.name: araignée
fr.definition: Animal de la classe des arachnides tissant une toile pour pièger ses proies.

fr.name: toile
fr.definition: Réseau de fils de soie sécrétée par les araignées.

fr.name: arachnide
fr.definition: Arthropode doté de quatre paires de pattes, formant une classe qui regroupe notamment les araignées et les scorpions.

fr.name: fil
fr.definition: Le fil est utilisé par l'araignée pour tisser sa toile.

fr.name: spider-man
fr.definition: Super-héros évoluant dans l'univers Marvel de la maison d'édition Marvel Comics.

fr.name: phobie
fr.definition: Une phobie est une peur démesurée et irrationnelle d'un objet ou d'une situation précise.

en.name: spider
en.definition: A spider is a small creature with eight legs. Most types of spider make structures called webs in which they catch insects for food.

en.name: web
en.definition: A web is the thin net made by a spider from a sticky substance which it produces in its body.

en.name: arachnid
en.definition: Any terrestrial chelicerate arthropod of the class Arachnida, characterized by simple eyes and four pairs of legs. The group includes the spiders, scorpions, ticks, mites, and harvestmen.

en.name: thread
en.definition: A spider uses its threads to spin its web.

en.name: spider-man
en.definition: Spider-Man is a fictional superhero created by writer-editor Stan Lee.

en.name: phobia
en.definition: A phobia is a type of anxiety disorder, defined by a persistent and excessive fear of an object or situation.

fr.name: loup
fr.definition: Mammifère sauvage appartenant à la famille des canidés. Il ressemble à un grand chien.

fr.name: griffe
fr.definition: Ongles crochus, pointus, acérés de certains animaux.

fr.name: hurlement
fr.definition: Cri aigu et prolongé.

fr.name: fourrure
fr.definition: Peau d'animal avec son poil travaillé de façon à servir de vêtement.

fr.name: loup-garou
fr.definition: Personnage légendaire qui se transforme en loup les nuits de pleine lune.

fr.name: meute
fr.definition: Ensemble de loups qui vivent en communauté.

en.name: wolf
en.definition: A wolf is a wild animal that looks like a large dog.

en.name: claw
en.definition: The claws of a bird or animal are the thin, hard, curved nails at the end of its feet.

en.name: howl
en.definition: If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound.

en.name: fur
en.definition: Fur is the thick and usually soft hair that grows on the bodies of many mammals.

en.name: werewolf
en.definition: A person changed into a wolf, or one capable of assuming the form of a wolf at will.

en.name: pack
en.definition: A group of wolves that live and hunt together.

fr.name: renard
fr.definition: Mammifère carnivore au museau pointu et au pelage roux.

fr.name: carnivore
fr.definition: Qui se nourrit de viande.

fr.name: roux
fr.definition: De couleur rousse, entre le jaune et le rouge.

fr.name: rusé
fr.definition: Astucieux, malicieux.

fr.name: renardeau
fr.definition: Le renardeau est le petit du renard et de la renarde.

fr.name: tanière
fr.definition: Antre, abri d'un animal sauvage.

en.name: fox
en.definition: A fox is a wild animal which looks like a dog and has reddish-brown fur, a pointed face and ears, and a thick tail.

en.name: carnivore
en.definition: A carnivore is an animal that eats meat.

en.name: red
en.definition: Foxy red is the colour of foxes, between yellow and red.

en.name: crafty
en.definition: If you describe someone as crafty, you mean that they achieve what they want in a clever way, often by deceiving people.

en.name: cub
en.definition: A cub is a young wild animal.

en.name: lair
en.definition: A lair is a place where a wild animal lives, usually a place which is underground or well-hidden.

fr.name: dragon
fr.definition: Animal fabuleux représenté avec des griffes, des ailes, une queue de serpent et crachant le feu.

fr.name: queue
fr.definition: Extrémité du corps de certains animaux.

fr.name: feu
fr.definition: Combustion d'un corps dégageant des flammes, de la chaleur et de la lumière.

fr.name: cracher
fr.definition: Éclabousser, projeter une substance.

fr.name: écaille
fr.definition: Plaque qui recouvre le corps de certains animaux (poissons, reptiles...).

fr.name: monstre
fr.definition: Être fantastique de la mythologie populaire.

en.name: dragon
en.definition: In stories and legends, a dragon is an animal like a big lizard. It has wings and claws, and breathes out fire.

en.name: tail
en.definition: The tail of an animal, bird, or fish is the part extending beyond the end of its body.

en.name: fire
en.definition: Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning.

en.name: spit
en.definition: If someone spits, they force an amount of liquid out of their mouth, often to show hatred or contempt.

en.name: scale
en.definition: The scales of a fish or reptile are the small, flat pieces of hard skin that cover its body.

en.name: monster
en.definition: A monster is a large imaginary creature that looks very ugly and frightening.

fr.name: drone
fr.definition: Petit avion sans pilote, télécommandé ou programmé, utilisé pour l'observation.

fr.name: pilote
fr.definition: Personne qui est chargée de conduire un avion, une voiture, un bateau...

fr.name: moteur
fr.definition: Appareil qui permet de transformer une énergie en énergie mécanique.

fr.name: missile
fr.definition: Engin explosif aérospatial qui se propulse de manière autonome et peut être dirigé par téléguidage ou autoguidage.

fr.name: surveillance
fr.definition: Action de surveiller, d’observer, de contrôler avec attention, d’examiner quelque chose ou quelqu’un.

fr.name: vol
fr.definition: Voyage aérien d'un avion ou d'un engin.

en.name: drone
en.definition: A drone is a type of aircraft that does not have a pilot and is controlled by someone on the ground.

en.name: pilot
en.definition: A pilot is a person who is trained to fly an aircraft.

en.name: engine
en.definition: The engine of a car or other vehicle is the part that produces the power which makes the vehicle move.

en.name: missile
en.definition: A missile is a tube-shaped weapon that travels long distances through the air and explodes when it reaches its target.

en.name: surveillance
en.definition: Surveillance is the careful watching of someone, especially by an organization such as the police or the army.

en.name: fly
en.definition: If you fly somewhere, you travel there in an aircraft.

fr.name: gorille
fr.definition: Gorille désigne un grand singe anthropoïde vivant dans les forêts de l'Afrique équatoriale, qui est frugivore et assez farouche.

fr.name: poilu
fr.definition: Couvert de poils.

fr.name: banane
fr.definition: Fruit comestible oblong et jaune du bananier.

fr.name: fort
fr.definition: Puissant physiquement.

fr.name: primate
fr.definition: Mammifère tel que le singe et l'homme.

fr.name: singe
fr.definition: Primate anthropoïde à face nue et aux membres préhensibles.

en.name: gorilla
en.definition: A gorilla is a very large ape. It has long arms, black fur, and a black face.

en.name: hairy
en.definition: Someone or something that is hairy is covered with hairs.

en.name: banana
en.definition: Bananas are long curved fruit with yellow skins.

en.name: strong
en.definition: Someone who is strong is healthy with good muscles and can move or carry heavy things, or do hard physical work.

en.name: primate
en.definition: A primate is a member of the group of mammals which includes humans, monkeys, and apes.

en.name: ape
en.definition: Apes are chimpanzees, gorillas, and other animals in the same family.
